line_1: The subtle Fish the vain Attempt perceives;
line_2: If he swims forward, and the Surface leaves,

line_1: Approaching War the Urchin soon perceives,
line_2: And hears the distant Rustle of the Leaves.
Put forth thy fresh and tender leaves,

line_1: And through the obscuring gloom the eye strange forms perceives.
line_2: Nor taper twinkles through the rustling leaves

line_1: And through the obscuring gloom the eye strange forms perceives.
line_2: But hark! a dismal sound the ear receives,
No grace, which plain proportion gives,

line_1: To gain thy Love; and then perceives
line_2: Thou wert not in the Rocks and Waves.

line_1: The angry nymph the God perceives
Infix'd, our dauntless Briton scarce perceives:
line_2: The Patriot views; for those alone He grieves.
